name: chart_1765450612106_chart
observations: Chart created on 2025-12-11T10:56:52.106Z

name: chart_1765450612106_desired_outcome
observations: An interactive music session controlled by iPhone motion, supported by a comprehensive set of deliverables: 1-2 playable examples, RISE Framework specifications (`./rispecs`) for key components and apps, and a documented MCP configuration to ensure project continuity and easy re-entry for future sessions.

name: chart_1765450612106_current_reality
observations: Project just forked, user unfamiliar with the package, desire for fun and interactive music control via iPhone OSC, possessing relevant iOS apps (TouchOSC, PhyOSC, MotionSender).
Planning for 'Set up the Supersonic environment to receive OSC signals' is complete, including proposal for Node.js OSC proxy server.
Planning for 'Explore and select the most suitable iOS app for sending motion data via OSC' is complete, with MotionSender recommended.
SuperSonic architecture fully reverse-engineered: ring buffer (768KB), atomic operations, OSC routing pathways documented
Created 2 RISE specs (33KB): supersonic-core-architecture.rise.md + ios-motion-apps.rise.md in rispecs/01530a36-0d32-4166-a715-19843ca6560f/
Documented 3 iOS apps: PhyOSC (Apple Watch), MotionSender (Wekinator ML), TouchOSC ($14.99 multi-touch)
Built osc-bridge-server.js: UDP port 8000 → WebSocket port 8080, auto-detects IPs, real-time logging
Created example-rotation-sound.html: Roll→freq (exponential 100-1000Hz), Pitch→amp, Yaw→pan, 3D phone viz, smoothing α=0.3
Created example-accelerometer-triggers.html: Shake/TiltUp/TiltDown/Rotate gestures, threshold detection, debouncing 500ms, visual feedback
Built supersonic-osc-mcp server: 5 tools (app info, mappings, setup, commands, smoothing), 6 resources, 3 prompts
Updated CLAUDE.md with complete iOS Motion-to-Sound Integration section: quick start, mappings table, troubleshooting, MCP installation
Proven sensor mappings documented: Roll→freq exponential, Pitch→amp linear, smoothing essential (α=0.3 removes jitter)
Total latency iOS→browser: 10-30ms (acceptable for gesture control), architecture enables sample-accurate timing
Completed: Set up the Supersonic environment to receive OSC signals.
Completed: Explore and select the most suitable iOS app for sending motion data via OSC.
Completed: Architect and Create RISE Specifications (`rispecs`).
Completed: Develop 1-2 Interactive Motion-to-Sound Examples.
Completed: Architect and Document an MCP Configuration for Project Re-entry.

name: chart_1765450764488_chart
observations: Chart created on 2025-12-11T10:59:24.488Z

name: chart_1765450764488_desired_outcome
observations: Set up the Supersonic environment to receive OSC signals.

name: chart_1765450764488_current_reality
observations: Initial investigation confirmed internal OSC communication but identified the need for a Node.js OSC proxy server to receive external UDP OSC, for which an architecture has been proposed.

name: chart_1765450847538_chart
observations: Chart created on 2025-12-11T11:00:47.538Z

name: chart_1765450847538_desired_outcome
observations: Explore and select the most suitable iOS app for sending motion data via OSC.

name: chart_1765450847538_current_reality
observations: All available iOS app descriptions have been reviewed, and MotionSender has been identified as the most suitable for sending iPhone motion data via OSC due to its explicit support for accelerometer, gyroscope, and attitude data, and its user-friendly approach for creative projects.

name: chart_1765451551353_current_reality
observations: The need for `rispecs` has been identified as a core deliverable, but no specifications have been drafted yet. Initial analysis has identified `supersonic`, the proposed `osc-proxy`, and the user's apps as primary candidates for specification.
